--- title: Post With Code author: Gleko Ma date: 2022/4/17 categories: - news - code - analysis image: image.jpg include-in-header: waline.html ---
This is a post with executable code. # Polar Axis For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see @fig-polar. ::: {.cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} import numpy as np import matplotlib.pyplot as plt r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01) theta = 2 * np.pi * r fig, ax = plt.subplots( subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} ) ax.plot(theta, r) ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2]) ax.grid(True) plt.show() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![A line plot on a polar axis](index_files\figure-html/fig-polar-output-1.png){#fig-polar width=443 height=432} ::: :::
